snippet: The Justice Department has claimed that the publishers used Apple as a conduit to communicate with each other; Apple lawyers have sought to portray the conversations as normal business proceedings.
abstract: Book publishers testify in civil antitrust trial stemming from 2012 Justice Dept lawsuit; contend that, rather than illegally conspiring to fix e-book prices, Apple and publishers were locked in intense negotiations in December 2009 and January 2010; proceedings provide glimpse into state of book business during period when Apple decided to enter e-book market.
lead_paragraph: The Justice Department has claimed that the publishers used Apple as a conduit to communicate with each other; Apple lawyers have sought to portray the conversations as normal business proceedings.

headline.seo: Publishers Tell of Disputes With Apple on E-Book Prices
headline.main: Publishers Tell of Disputes With Apple on E-Book Prices
headline.print_headline: Publishers Tell of Disputes With Apple on E-Book Prices
